Package com.example.beginnerdemo.controller

Class PersonController

java.lang.Object
com.example.beginnerdemo.controller.PersonController
@RestController @RequestMapping("api/v1/person") public class PersonController extends Object
1. This class receives different HTTP requests from clients. These requests can be in the form of GET, POST, PUT, DELETE Annotate it with @RestController

2. To specify the URI or the path this request will be received, just annotate @RequestMapping

  • Method Details

    • addPerson

      @PostMapping public void addPerson​(@RequestBody @Validated @NonNull Person person)
      This method specifies that is accepts POST request from client, thus the @PostMapping annotation
      Parameters:
      person - - Tell the spring that we want to get the request body and shovel that to the Person object. - the Person model will auto-convert the JSON object - To do that, simply add @RequestBody Path: 'localhost:8080/api/v1/person/'

    • getAllPeople

      @GetMapping public List<Person> getAllPeople()
      This method specifies that it accepts GET request from client. Path: 'localhost:8080/api/v1/person/'
      Returns:

    • getPersonById

      @GetMapping(path="{id}") public Person getPersonById​(@PathVariable("id") @NonNull UUID id)
      This method specifies that it accepts GET request from client. Additionally, an ID is concatenated to know which record is to be retrieved. Sample path: 'localhost:8080/api/v1/person/801e5ea5-fd4c-4a46-8c22-4b7d55c1a45f'
      Returns:

    • getPersonByEmail

      @GetMapping(params="{email}") public Person getPersonByEmail​(@RequestParam("email") String email)
      TODO: BUG, when calling this method it returns all the people from the DB This method accepts GET request from client with the request parameter email. Sample path: 'localhost:8080/api/v1/person/email=akinner5@usa.gov'
      Parameters:
      email -
      Returns:

    • updatePersonById

      @PutMapping(path="{id}") public int updatePersonById​(@PathVariable("id") UUID id, @RequestBody @NonNull @Validated Person person)
      This method accepts PUT request from client. ID is concatenated at the path eg. 'localhost:8080/api/v1/person/801e5ea5-fd4c-4a46-8c22-4b7d55c1a45f'
      Parameters:
      id -
      person -
      Returns:

    • deletePersonById

      @DeleteMapping(params="id") public int deletePersonById​(@RequestParam("id") UUID id)
      This method accepts a DELETE request from client. ID is part of the request parameter of the request. This is just to show variant to show how to pass the ID for delete.
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:
